examSummary.fullName: EUEE Civic and Ethical Education 2005 Grade 12
examSummary.subject: Biology

questionList.questionStatement: Of the following which one is among the prerequisites for political, social and economic development of a country?
questionList.choiceB: Transfer of power.
questionList.choiceC: Periodic election.
questionList.choiceD: Multi Part system.

questionList.questionStatement: A state where religion and state are separate is called
questionList.choiceB: Theocratic.
questionList.choiceC: Secular.
questionList.choiceD: Neural

questionList.questionStatement: The members of the House of Federation of FDRE are elected by the:
questionList.choiceB: Executives the regional states.
questionList.choiceC: Presidents of the regional states.
questionList.choiceD: Electors in the regional states.

questionList.questionStatement: Who has the power to introduce laws at regional state level in FDRE?
questionList.choiceB: State Council.
questionList.choiceC: State president.
questionList.choiceD: State Supreme Court.

questionList.questionStatement: Which of the following group of people aware considered inferior to others in the traditional Ethiopian society?
questionList.choiceB: teachers
questionList.choiceC: Farmers.
questionList.choiceD: Singers.

questionList.questionStatement: The most vocal opposition to the regime of Haile Sellassie I, particularly during its last stage came from :
questionList.choiceB: dissatisfied ordinary peasants.
questionList.choiceC: industrial workers and teachers.
questionList.choiceD: students and the educated elite.

questionList.questionStatement: How many seats shall be reserved for all minority nationalities and peoples in the House of People's Representatives as provided by the FDRE Constitution?
questionList.choiceB: 20 seats
questionList.choiceC: 30 seats
questionList.choiceD: 10 seats

questionList.questionStatement: Who is the source of the legitimate power of the FDRE?
questionList.choiceB: Supreme Court.
questionList.choiceC: The people
questionList.choiceD: The army

questionList.questionStatement: Which of the following is a crime that is mainly committed for the purpose of gaining personal wealth?
questionList.choiceB: Corruption
questionList.choiceC: Treachery
questionList.choiceD: Torture

questionList.questionStatement: Identify a conflict resolution mechanism in which the third party makes decisions.
questionList.choiceB: Arbitration
questionList.choiceC: Mediation
questionList.choiceD: Litigation

questionList.questionStatement: Which of the following gives a general definition of corruption in a better manner?
questionList.choiceA: Corruption is taking bribes for official services.
questionList.choiceB: Corruption is the misuse of public property and money.
questionList.choiceC: Corruption is the abuse of public office for private gain.
questionList.choiceD: Corruption is forceful act of obliging people to pay for official services.

questionList.questionStatement: Which of the following is morally wrong according to the Ethiopian culture?
questionList.choiceB: Breaking promises.
questionList.choiceC: Helping the needy.
questionList.choiceD: Participating in social affairs.

questionList.questionStatement: The Millennium Development Goals include all of the following, except?
questionList.choiceA: Providing primary education for all children of the world.
questionList.choiceB: Reducing Infant mortality by ninety percent.
questionList.choiceC: Making the poor rich.
questionList.choiceD: Eradicating gender inequality in education.

questionList.questionStatement: The present flag in green, yellow and red probably became the national flag of Ethiopia during the time of:
questionList.choiceB: Emperor Yohannes IV
questionList.choiceC: Empress Zewdittu
questionList.choiceD: Emperor Menelik II

questionList.questionStatement: What is the major advantage of fulfilling our obligations as Ethiopian citizens?
questionList.choiceB: Getting spiritual satisfaction.
questionList.choiceC: Enjoying our rights in return.
questionList.choiceD: Getting financial reward.

questionList.questionStatement: Which of the following professions (occupations) has long been the most undermined one among many Ethiopian communities?
questionList.choiceB: Shoe shining
questionList.choiceC: Pottery.
questionList.choiceD: Woodwork.

questionList.questionStatement: Which of the following is generally taken as 'male oriented' job in the Ethiopian tradition?
questionList.choiceB: Looking after children.
questionList.choiceC: Collecting firewood.
questionList.choiceD: Long distance trade.

questionList.questionStatement: Why do many Ethiopians prefer to use imported products than the local ones?
questionList.choiceA: Because all local products have poor qualities.
questionList.choiceB: Because all imported products have good qualities.
questionList.choiceC: Because there is a bad habit of giving low value for local products.
questionList.choiceD: Because Ethiopians have very little knowledge of making local products.

questionList.questionStatement: Which of the following is true about Idir and Equb?
questionList.choiceA: Both are traditional saving institutions in Ethiopia.
questionList.choiceB: Both are practised only in the rural parts of Ethiopia.
questionList.choiceC: Idir is not associated with saving.
questionList.choiceD: Equb is a backward saving system which is now being totally replaced by modern banking.

questionList.questionStatement: Which of the following is NOT among the components of knowledge?
questionList.choiceB: Evidence
questionList.choiceC: Data
questionList.choiceD: Myth

questionList.questionStatement: Which of the following is NOT true about democratic constitution?
questionList.choiceA: It paves the way for constitutionalism and democracy.
questionList.choiceB: It limits the power of government.
questionList.choiceC: It does not allow extra-constitutional authorities.
questionList.choiceD: It does not stipulate directly the rights and duties of citizens.

questionList.questionStatement: Ethiopia's foreign policy is based, primarily, on the country's:
questionList.choiceB: strong military power.
questionList.choiceC: benefits and interests only.
questionList.choiceD: mutual benefits and cordial relationship.

questionList.questionStatement: Which of the following is NOT true about direct democracy?
questionList.choiceA: It works among communities of small size.
questionList.choiceB: It is represented today in the form of referendum or plebiscites.
questionList.choiceC: It allows all participants to pass decisions on their own affairs.
questionList.choiceD: It was practiced by ancient Greeks whereby both men and women were active participants.

questionList.questionStatement: What is the major advantage of federalism?
questionList.choiceB: Promoting cultures and languages.
questionList.choiceC: Unifying different peoples of a country.
questionList.choiceD: Creating interregional economic cooperation.

questionList.questionStatement: Identify the country that has combined both parliamentary and presidential systems of democracy together.
questionList.choiceB: England
questionList.choiceC: South Africa
questionList.choiceD: France

questionList.questionStatement: Which of the following is true?
questionList.choiceA: Ethiopia's constitution gives priority for individual rights.
questionList.choiceB: Ethiopia's constitution gives priority for collective rights.
questionList.choiceC: Ethiopia's constitution protects collective rights at the expense of individual rights.
questionList.choiceD: Ethiopia's constitution protects both collective and individual rights.

questionList.questionStatement: The regional state of Afar has full authority to do all of the following, but:
questionList.choiceB: establishing regional police force. .
questionList.choiceC: establishing independent diplomatic relations with Djibouti.
questionList.choiceD: using its natural resources for regional development.

questionList.questionStatement: Why did Ethiopia remain to be the only African country that was never colonized?
questionList.choiceB: Because Europeans were not interested in it.
questionList.choiceC: Because she had successfully defended foreign aggressions.
questionList.choiceD: Because she had a very strong foreign policy from the beginning.

questionList.questionStatement: What is the major possible motive for corruption in countries like Ethiopia?
questionList.choiceB: Resource scarcity and competition in the economy.
questionList.choiceC: Absence of the rule of law and constitutionalism.
questionList.choiceD: Greediness and searching a short-cut for accumulation of wealth.

questionList.questionStatement: How was the derg overthrown?
questionList.choiceB: Through armed struggle.
questionList.choiceC: Through political dialogue.
questionList.choiceD: Through peasant rebellion.

questionList.questionStatement: Which of the following is true about Positive discrimination?
questionList.choiceA: It is used to make women equal to men.
questionList.choiceB: It is used to stop domestic violence.
questionList.choiceC: It is used to restrict women at home.
questionList.choiceD: It is used to compensate women for the past injustice.

questionList.questionStatement: One of the following peasant rebellions was crushed by the joint efforts of the Imperial Government and British forces.
questionList.choiceB: The first Woyane movement.
questionList.choiceC: The Second Woyane Movement.
questionList.choiceD: The Gojjam peasant rebellion.

questionList.questionStatement: How and when do multicultural societies like Ethiopia exist in peace?
questionList.choiceA: When there is mutual respect for one another.
questionList.choiceB: When there is strong military government.
questionList.choiceC: When there is written constitution.
questionList.choiceD: When there is strong, independent judiciary.

questionList.questionStatement: According to Ethiopian law the responsibility of signing international conventions and agreements is given to:
questionList.choiceB: the Judiciary branch.
questionList.choiceC: the Legislative branch.
questionList.choiceD: the House of Federation.

questionList.questionStatement: The period of the derg was characterized by all of the following negative experiences, EXCEPT:
questionList.choiceB: literacy Campaign.
questionList.choiceC: forced military service (Afesa)
questionList.choiceD: absence of religious freedom.

questionList.questionStatement: Identify the WRONG statement from the given alternatives.
questionList.choiceA: Payment of taxes should be based on people's capacity to pay.
questionList.choiceB: Tax payers have the right to get social services from the government.
questionList.choiceC: Tax payers have the right to be informed about government budget.
questionList.choiceD: The duty of tax payers is just to pay taxes, not to demand social services.

questionList.questionStatement: Which of the following is NOT true about voluntary organizations?
questionList.choiceB: They are independent of government.
questionList.choiceC: They usually work towards social well being.
questionList.choiceD: They cooperate with governments and other organizations to tackle common problems.

questionList.questionStatement: I have a dream that my four little children will one day live in a nation where they will not be judged by the color of their skin but by the content of their character. I have a dream today! This famous quotation is associated to:
questionList.choiceB: Rosa Parks
questionList.choiceC: Abraham Lincoln
questionList.choiceD: Martin Luther King

questionList.questionStatement: Student Bezawit treats people with respect both in school and outside unlike many of her close friends. Which of the following civic virtues explain her best?
questionList.choiceB: Truthfulness
questionList.choiceC: Civility
questionList.choiceD: Courage

questionList.questionStatement: As an Ethiopian student why do you learn your history and culture?
questionList.choiceA: In order to build ethnocentric feelings.
questionList.choiceB: In order to appreciate past achievements.
questionList.choiceC: In order to bring about Cultural Revolution.
questionList.choiceD: In order to learn from the past and shape your values and beliefs.

questionList.questionStatement: Which of the following cultural, man made heritages of Ethiopia is recently registered by UNESCO as World Heritage?
questionList.choiceB: The Evangadi ceremony.
questionList.choiceC: The Gedeo Megalithic stones.
questionList.choiceD: The Konso Cultural Landscape.

questionList.questionStatement: One of the following is NOT the behaviour of responsible citizens:
questionList.choiceB: Protecting it natural heritages.
questionList.choiceC: Working hard to improve living conditions.
questionList.choiceD: Charging extra for official services.

questionList.questionStatement: Which of the following is true cross-boundary rivers?
questionList.choiceA: Ethiopia does not have cross-boundary rivers.
questionList.choiceB: Cross-boundary rivers are found only in the Middle East.
questionList.choiceC: Cross boundary rivers create the condition for countries to have a special relationship.
questionList.choiceD: Cross-boundary rivers cannot used for common be development projects.

questionList.questionStatement: Identify the WRONG statement about nuclear weapons.
questionList.choiceA: Any war involving nuclear weapons could bring an end to human race.
questionList.choiceB: The number of countries that possess nuclear weapons is increasing from time to time.
questionList.choiceC: Nuclear weapons do not have long term effects.
questionList.choiceD: Hiroshima and Nagasaki are good examples of the danger that can be caused by nuclear weapons.

questionList.questionStatement: Which of the following is the most advisable, safe way of protecting yourselves from HlV/AIDS infection as yOung students?
questionList.choiceB: Avoiding boy/girl friends.
questionList.choiceC: Avoiding pre-marital sexual contact.
questionList.choiceD: Having only one partner for sexual contact.

questionList.questionStatement: Which of the following is NOT true about HIV/AIDS?
questionList.choiceA: It is a global problem that needs global intervention.
questionList.choiceB: It. is number one killer disease in the developed world.
questionList.choiceC: It conspires with infections such as tuberculosis, malaria, typhoid and hepatitis.
questionList.choiceD: Improving the living standards of poor nations is one way of Combating HIV/AIDS

questionList.questionStatement: Which of the following institutions has no role in shaping globalization?
questionList.choiceB: Transparency International
questionList.choiceC: World Trade Organization
questionList.choiceD: International Monetary Fund

questionList.questionStatement: Because human rights are inalienable and inviolable birth rights governments should:
questionList.choiceB: Recognize and respect them
questionList.choiceC: Bestow them on their people
questionList.choiceD: Include them in their constitutions

questionList.questionStatement: Democratic mode of governance is preferred over other modes of governance because it:
questionList.choiceA: insures equality of citizens in everything.
questionList.choiceB: guarantees equitable distribution of wealth.
questionList.choiceC: creates equal opportunities for citizens.
questionList.choiceD: assures economic prosperity of a nation.

questionList.questionStatement: Which of the following statement is true regarding Ethiopia in relation to the League of Nations?
questionList.choiceA: The League failed Ethiopia when she was invaded by Italy.
questionList.choiceB: Ethiopia was a founding member of the League of Nations.
questionList.choiceC: Ethiopia represented African Nations in the League of Nations.
questionList.choiceD: The Ethiopia withdrew from the League when Italy invaded her.

questionList.questionStatement: Tolerance to differences among peoples demands primarily one's ability to:
questionList.choiceB: do away with difference
questionList.choiceC: accept differences as national
questionList.choiceD: learn about national difference

questionList.questionStatement: Whose appointment should be approved by the parliament of FDRE?
questionList.choiceA: President of the Federal Supreme Court.
questionList.choiceB: Chair Person of the House of Federation.
questionList.choiceC: President of a Regional State Council.
questionList.choiceD: Ethiopian Ambassadors and Envoys.

questionList.questionStatement: Where ever there is a strong and independent judiciary it is safe to expect
questionList.choiceB: presence of Federal system of government.
questionList.choiceC: prevalence of respect for rule of law.
questionList.choiceD: the Executive to be afraid of the courts.

questionList.questionStatement: An unbiased employer should select workers for any type of job by taking into account the applicant's:
questionList.choiceB: family social position.
questionList.choiceC: race and religious affiliation.
questionList.choiceD: age and marital status.

questionList.questionStatement: A government that respects the rule of law in its functions will be able to:
questionList.choiceA: stay in power whatever it does to the people.
questionList.choiceB: win the confidence and acceptance of the people.
questionList.choiceC: exercise supreme and absolute power over the people.
questionList.choiceD: conceal any type of human right abuse of citizens.

questionList.questionStatement: The FDRE government can nationalize privately owned property provided that:
questionList.choiceA: the property is owned by a suspected criminal.
questionList.choiceB: the owner failed to pay taxes or bank loans.
questionList.choiceC: the owner is amply or adequately compensated.
questionList.choiceD: the property is found to be unproductive under the owner.

questionList.questionStatement: According to Pragmatic theory, truth:
questionList.choiceA: works for a given time and space.
questionList.choiceB: has universal acceptance at a certain time.
questionList.choiceC: transcends space but not time.
questionList.choiceD: never changes from time to time.

questionList.questionStatement: Many people have little understanding that while enjoying the right to equality they are required to:
questionList.choiceA: ensure that they are capable of enjoying it.
questionList.choiceB: earn it through their struggle.
questionList.choiceC: enter into identical obligations with others.
questionList.choiceD: enjoy similar and- identical rights with others.

questionList.questionStatement: Progressive taxation system is a method of:
questionList.choiceA: levying equal tax on all irrespective of their income.
questionList.choiceB: collecting tax at a rate proportionate to payer's income.
questionList.choiceC: encouraging investors by reducing their tax rate progressively.
questionList.choiceD: making rich people pay high rate of taxation than poor people.

questionList.questionStatement: Education enables the educated first and foremost to:
questionList.choiceA: become a politician and community leader.
questionList.choiceB: honestly serve country and people one day.
questionList.choiceC: become successful and lead comfortable life.
questionList.choiceD: have better understanding of self and society.

questionList.questionStatement: Which of the following is one of the major functions of the government of FDRE?
questionList.choiceB: Managing primary education.
questionList.choiceC: Ratifying regional Constitution.
questionList.choiceD: Appointing regional presidents.

questionList.questionStatement: In theory, markets in free-market economies are regulated by:
questionList.choiceB: amicable relationship between sellers and buyers.
questionList.choiceC: freedom given to merchants to fix prices honestly.
questionList.choiceD: abundance of goods and services in the market.

questionList.questionStatement: What are the two major categories of rights stated in the constitution of FDRE?
questionList.choiceB: Human and Democratic Rights.
questionList.choiceC: National and Regional Rights.
questionList.choiceD: Civil and Social Rights.

questionList.questionStatement: During election campaigning political parties should devote much of their time and energy for
questionList.choiceA: collecting money contributions from their supporters.
questionList.choiceB: defaming opposition political parties and their leaders.
questionList.choiceC: winning as much support as possible for their policies.
questionList.choiceD: promising rewards for their members and supporters.

questionList.questionStatement: Development of a certain country is finally judged by the improvement it brought to the:
questionList.choiceB: nation's health and education facilities.
questionList.choiceC: lives of peoples of the country.
questionList.choiceD: communication infrastructure of the country.

questionList.questionStatement: Self-confident individuals are always ready to:
questionList.choiceA: hold back from telling the truth about others.
questionList.choiceB: flatter others in order to gain their good will.
questionList.choiceC: accept logical arguments and learn from them.
questionList.choiceD: avoid challenging situations or arguments.

questionList.questionStatement: Many youngsters fall victim to the habit of smoking mainly because they:
questionList.choiceA: live far from their parents and relatives.
questionList.choiceB: have income of their own at an early age.
questionList.choiceC: realize that smoking is mark of modernity.
questionList.choiceD: lack courage to resist their peers' influence.

questionList.questionStatement: The principles of free market economy include all of the following, except:
questionList.choiceA: freedom of decision to economic agents.
questionList.choiceB: less government involvement in the market.
questionList.choiceC: letting market forces determine the extent of transactions and prices.
questionList.choiceD: having prices fixed for commodities by the government.

questionList.questionStatement: What are the two major international monetary institutions?
questionList.choiceB: World Bank and WHO
questionList.choiceC: World Bank and IMF
questionList.choiceD: IMF and FAQ

questionList.questionStatement: A lawful gathering of people to protest, support or create awareness on a certain issue implies:
questionList.choiceB: peaceful demonstration
questionList.choiceC: popular participation
questionList.choiceD: political freedom

questionList.questionStatement: Which of the following is true about myths?
questionList.choiceA: Myths are unscientific stories that people would like to tell and believe
questionList.choiceB: Myths are scientific stories based on empirical evidence
questionList.choiceC: Myths are found in the traditions and cultures of African peoples only
questionList.choiceD: Myths can help us transform our knowledge

questionList.questionStatement: Which of the following is NOT among the rights of persons who are accused of any criminal offence?
questionList.choiceA: The right to be considered innocent until the final verdict is given.
questionList.choiceB: The right to choose judges.
questionList.choiceC: The right to tried in the language they understand better.
questionList.choiceD: The right to fair justice.

questionList.questionStatement: Which of the following is the major reason that made Addis Ababa one of the diplomatic hubs of the world and the seat of African Union (the former OAU)?
questionList.choiceA: Because it one of the few big, beautiful cities in the world.
questionList.choiceB: Because it is the place where cultural diversity and tolerance are well cultivated.
questionList.choiceC: Because Ethiopia had played commendable role in African and international politics.
questionList.choiceD: Because Ethiopia is a good example of wonderful hospitality.

questionList.questionStatement: Which of the following countries has ancient relations with Ethiopia?
questionList.choiceB: Sudan
questionList.choiceC: Greece
questionList.choiceD: Egypt

questionList.questionStatement: The conduct of legal proceedings according to established rules and principles for the protection of and enforcement of private rights is known as:
questionList.choiceB: Due process of law.
questionList.choiceC: Protection of civil rights.
questionList.choiceD: Fair justice.

questionList.questionStatement: Which of the following is NOT true?
questionList.choiceB: HIV/AIDS is transmitted mainly through careless sexual intercourse.
questionList.choiceC: HIV/AIDS has nothing to do with the economic situations of a nation.
questionList.choiceD: HIV/AIDS creates a serious socio-economic challenge in today's world

questionList.questionStatement: Which of the following is NOT true according to Article 18 of the FDRE Constitution?
questionList.choiceA: No one shall be held in slavery or servitude.
questionList.choiceB: Trafficking in human beings for whatever purpose is prohibited.
questionList.choiceC: Everyone has the right to protection against inhuman punishments.
questionList.choiceD: Everyone has the right to assemble or demonstrate.

questionList.questionStatement: When do countries usually form closer relationship and create a forum for cooperation?
questionList.choiceA: When they have commonly shared objectives.
questionList.choiceB: When they have strong, charismatic leaders.
questionList.choiceC: When they have developed economies.
questionList.choiceD: When they face social crisis.

questionList.questionStatement: Medical Ethical standards include all of the following, EXCEPT:
questionList.choiceA: giving loyalty and support to fellow physicians.
questionList.choiceB: treating all patients equally.
questionList.choiceC: giving assistance to those who wanted to commit suicide.
questionList.choiceD: keeping the secretes of patients confidentially.

questionList.questionStatement: Which of the following is NOT true about dependency?
questionList.choiceA: It will create unbalanced economic relationship.
questionList.choiceB: It will create free market accesses to wealthy nations.
questionList.choiceC: It will make poor countries import manufactured goods, obsolete or used.
questionList.choiceD: It will result in sustainable economic growth.

questionList.questionStatement: Which of the following is true about Ethiopia's development projects on her rivers?
questionList.choiceA: Ethiopia has started to use her rivers primarily for the production of hydro-electric power.
questionList.choiceB: Ethiopia has fully utilized her rivers for irrigation.
questionList.choiceC: Ethiopia did not need to use her rivers because she has a lot of mineral deposits.
questionList.choiceD: Ethiopia's development policy focuses more on agriculture ignoring the question of utilizing her rivers.

questionList.questionStatement: Which of the following is true about Macro economics?
questionList.choiceA: It deals with the behaviour of individual economic agents.
questionList.choiceB: It deals with the working of the overall economy.
questionList.choiceC: It deals with the activities of industrial sector.
questionList.choiceD: It deals with traditional saving mechanisms.

questionList.questionStatement: Which one of the following is true about modern saving institutions in Ethiopia?
questionList.choiceA: Modern saving institutions include Banks and Insurance companies.
questionList.choiceB: Modern saving institutions are inaccessible to the majority of the people.
questionList.choiceC: Modern saving institutions have completely replaced the traditional ones.
questionList.choiceD: Modern saving institutions are owned by the government alone.

questionList.questionStatement: Which of the following mechanisms can be suggested to improve saving habits in Ethiopia?
questionList.choiceB: Avoiding social interactions and commitments.
questionList.choiceC: Increasing salaries of government workers every year.
questionList.choiceD: Limiting one's interests to one's income amount.

questionList.questionStatement: which of the following is true according to Article 29 of the FDRE constitution
questionList.choiceA: Everyone has the right to freedom of expression without any interference.
questionList.choiceB: Everyone has the right to follow any religion of his/her own choice.
questionList.choiceC: Anyone has the right to form opposition political party.
questionList.choiceD: Anyone has the right to be elected.

questionList.questionStatement: Democratic and non-democratic states widely differ in terms of the use of authority and power. Which of the following statements is correct in this regard?
questionList.choiceA: Non-democratic states use their power to enforce their authority.
questionList.choiceB: Power is the source of the authority of democratic state.
questionList.choiceC: Democratic states lack legitimate authority to enforce their power.
questionList.choiceD: Non-democratic states use their authority to enforce their power.

questionList.questionStatement: Societal development is better achieved under a transparent democratic government than otherwise because such a government will have:
questionList.choiceA: ability not to make mistakes that seriously hamper development.
questionList.choiceB: resources useful for economic development at is disposal.
questionList.choiceC: better chance of winning support of the people for its endeavours.
questionList.choiceD: no opposition and critiques of its work from among the people.

questionList.questionStatement: To which of the following activities should the emerging regions of Ethiopia give priority while allocating resources?
questionList.choiceB: Provision of basic health care and basic education.
questionList.choiceC: Construction of a network of asphalted highways.
questionList.choiceD: Expansion of mechanized farms and industries.

questionList.questionStatement: Democratic system of government is the preferred system in many countries of the world because it:
questionList.choiceA: eliminates all social, political and economic problems of a country.
questionList.choiceB: accepts the principle that majority decisions are always right.
questionList.choiceC: assures absolute social, economic and political equality in a country.
questionList.choiceD: addresses the interests of citizens in a relatively better way.

questionList.questionStatement: The democratic values in the constitution of FDRE can be part of social structures and practices of the people only if they are:
questionList.choiceA: approved by the House of Peoples' Representatives.
questionList.choiceB: part of the Universal Declaration of Human Rights.
questionList.choiceC: able to win the trust and confidence of the society.
questionList.choiceD: approved by an elected constituent assembly.

questionList.questionStatement: Civic societies can play vital role in democratic system in a country by:
questionList.choiceA: standing against a government believe to be undemocratic.
questionList.choiceB: encouraging constructive participation of people in public affairs.
questionList.choiceC: organizing a democratic party and participating in elections.
questionList.choiceD: supporting a government disregarding the will of their members.

questionList.questionStatement: To improve the life of their peoples governments of developing countries should:
questionList.choiceA: allocate greater budget for expansion of social services.
questionList.choiceB: fix the price of basic necessities like food and clothing.
questionList.choiceC: give economic subsidies to the poor so that they can compete.
questionList.choiceD: provide food and material aid to the needy people.

questionList.questionStatement: In what language can all the members the federation execute their public functions according to the FDRE Constitution?
questionList.choiceB: Language that is common for all of them.
questionList.choiceC: Their mother tongue or home language.
questionList.choiceD: The working language of the Federation.

questionList.questionStatement: Ethiopian farmers are encouraged to produce and use organic fertilizers, as much as possible, mainly because these fertilizers are:
questionList.choiceA: proved to give much greater yield the inorganic ones.
questionList.choiceB: sought after by exporters and could bring foreign exchange.
questionList.choiceC: easily produced in large quantities and sell to other farmers.
questionList.choiceD: environmentally friendly and do not harm the land.

questionList.questionStatement: According to the modern understanding of freedom a person is not free until he/she is free from
questionList.choiceB: lack of all basic necessities of life.
questionList.choiceC: cruel and oppressive local governments.
questionList.choiceD: restriction on democratic and human rights.

questionList.questionStatement: The role assigned to women by traditional societies impeded national development by:
questionList.choiceA: depriving the country the chance to fully exploit their potentials.
questionList.choiceB: causing irreconcilable differences with their male partners.
questionList.choiceC: making them mentally weak and emotionally sensitive.
questionList.choiceD: encouraging them to demonstrate their skill and ability publicly.

questionList.questionStatement: Many of the communicable disease in Ethiopia could be eradicated by:
questionList.choiceA: Enabling people to have easy access to modern hospitals
questionList.choiceB: Assigning doctors and other professionals in rural areas.
questionList.choiceC: Making people put simple hygiene rules into practice.
questionList.choiceD: Distributing medicines for the diseases periodically.

questionList.questionStatement: There is a need for the regional states of FDRE to grow and develop together because the regional states are:
questionList.choiceB: capable of fulfilling their economic needs.
questionList.choiceC: found at various stage of economic development.
questionList.choiceD: engaged in developing similar economic capacities.

questionList.questionStatement: To motivate followers an effective leader should:
questionList.choiceA: be flexible enough to learn from works of others.
questionList.choiceB: design plan of action and force others to accept it.
questionList.choiceC: have vision and manage to impose it on followers.
questionList.choiceD: have commitment for the objective of the task.

questionList.questionStatement: One true measure of a person's greatness could be her/his:
questionList.choiceA: readiness to criticize the works of others always.
questionList.choiceB: ability to identify errors made by productive people.
questionList.choiceC: tangible accomplishment to solve societal problems.
questionList.choiceD: social position and ability to socialize with others.
